articles.title: Kim Jong Un Greets Russian President
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Greets Russian President
 Pyongyang, June 12 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, first chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK, Wednesday sent a message of greeting to Vladimir Vladimirovich Putin, president of the Russian Federation, on its national day.
					 He in the message extended congratulations to the president and people of Russia on its national day.
					
					 The message said the Russian people have registered many successes in modernizing the economy, bolstering national defense capability and ensuring social stability under the leadership of the president.
					
					 The DPRK is pleased with this, the message said, hoping that the efforts of the president and his people to protect the peace and security of the world and build strong Russia would bear good fruit.
					
					 Availing himself of this opportunity, he expressed the belief that the traditional DPRK-Russia friendly ties will continue to expand and develop in the spirit of the joint documents agreed between both sides.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Greets President of Philippines
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Greets President of Philippines
 Pyongyang, June 12 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, Wednesday sent a message of greeting to Benigno Simeon Cojuangco Aquino, president of the Republic of Philippines, on the occasion of the 115th anniversary of  its independence.
					 The message expressed belief that the relations between the DPRK and Philippines would develop in conformity with the common interests and desire of the two peoples, wishing the president of Philippines success in his work for the progress of the country and its prosperity.

articles.title: Pak Ui Chun Greets FM of Philippines
articles.content:
Pak Ui Chun Greets FM of Philippines
 Pyongyang, June 12 (KCNA) -- DPRK Foreign Minister Pak Ui Chun Wednesday sent a message of greeting to Albert F. del Rosario, foreign minister of Philippines, on the occasion of the 115th anniversary of its independence.
					 The message expressed expectation that the bilateral relations would develop in the idea of independence, peace and friendship.

articles.title: Citations Awarded to Contributors to Sprucing up Kumsusan Palace
articles.content:
Citations Awarded to Contributors to Sprucing up Kumsusan Palace
Pyongyang, June 12 (KCNA) -- The DPRK awarded citations to 5,544 soldiers, officials and other people, youth and students who devoted their warm sincerity and performed shining labor feats in sprucing up the Kumsusan Palace of the Sun as the sacred temple of Juche.
					 The title of DPRK labor hero was awarded to Han Jong Bom and eight others, Order of Kim Il Sung to Cha Hyon Sang and Kim Il Sung Youth Honor Prize 9 others.
					
					The title of merited technician was conferred on one person, the title of merited builder on three persons, the title of merited driver on one person, Order of National Flag First Class on 79 persons, Order of Labor on 80 persons, Order of National Flag Second Class on 685 persons, Order of Soldier's Honor First Class on 90 persons, Order of National Flag Third Class on 1,008 persons, Order of Solder's Honor Second Class on 505 persons, Distinguished Military Service Medal on 2 474 persons and Medal of Merit on 599 persons.
					
					 A decree in this regard was promulgated by the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK on June 12.

articles.title: Wreaths Sent to Indonesian Embassy
articles.content:
Wreaths Sent to Indonesian Embassy
 Pyongyang, June 12 (KCNA) -- Armed forces and power bodies, ministries and national institutions sent wreaths to the Indonesian embassy here on Tuesday and Wednesday, expressing condolences over the death of Taufiq Kiemas, former speaker of the People's Consultative Assembly of Indonesia.
					 Laid before the photo of the deceased were wreaths from the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK,  Ministry of the People's Armed Forces, Ministry of Foreign Affairs, Korean Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries, Korea-Indonesia Friendship Association and the General Bureau for Affairs with Diplomatic Corps.
					
					 Present there were Kim Wan Su, vice-chairman of the Supreme People's Assembly, Pak Kil Yon, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs, Kim Jin Bom, vice-chairman of the Korean Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries and chairman of the Korea-Indonesia Friendship Association, Mun Jae Chol, vice-director of the General Bureau for Affairs with Diplomatic Corps, and officials concerned.
					
					 The participants observed a moment's silence in memory of the deceased before making entries in the mourners' book.

articles.title: Diplomatic Envoys Pay Condolatory Visits to Indonesian Embassy
articles.content:
Diplomatic Envoys Pay Condolatory Visits to Indonesian Embassy
 Pyongyang, June 12 (KCNA) -- Diplomatic envoys of different countries and representatives of international organizations here visited the Indonesian embassy on Tuesday and Wednesday to express condolences over the death of Taufiq Kiemas, former speaker of the People's Consultative Assembly of Indonesia.
					 They made entries in the mourners' book.

articles.title: Floral Tribute Paid to Fallen Fighters of Soviet Army
articles.content:
Floral Tribute Paid to Fallen Fighters of Soviet Army
 Pyongyang, June 12 (KCNA) -- Staff members of the Russian embassy here laid a wreath before the Liberation Towers on Wednesday to mark the national day of Russia.
					 Present at the wreath-laying ceremony were Russian Ambassador to the DPRK Alexandr Timonin and staff members of his embassy.
					
					 After a wreath was laid before the tower in the name of the Russian embassy, the participants observed a moment's silence in memory of the fallen fighters of the Soviet Army.
					
					 They went round the tower.
					
					 Staff members laid a wreath and bouquets before the cemetery of fallen fighters of the Soviet Army in Sadong District, Pyongyang.
					
					 The consul general and staff members of the Russian consulate general in Chongjin, North Hamgyong Province laid wreaths before the liberation tower and the cemetery of fallen fighters of the Soviet Army in the city.
					
					 The consulate general gave a reception that day on the occasion.

articles.title: Cuban Embassy Members Help Korean Farmers
articles.content:
Cuban Embassy Members Help Korean Farmers
 Pyongyang, June 12 (KCNA) -- Cuban Ambassador German Hermin Ferras Alvarez and staff members of his embassy here did friendly labor at the DPRK-Cuba Friendship Hwasong Greenhouse Vegetable Farm on Wednesday.
					 The guests helped farmers in weeding.
					
					 During a break they talked with officials of the farm, deepening the friendship.
					
					 The ambassador hoped that the farmers would make innovations in agricultural production under the leadership of the dear respected Kim Jong Un.
					
					 The staff members handed aid materials to the farm.

articles.title: AINDF Members Visit Monument to Three Charters for National Reunification
articles.content:
AINDF Members Visit Monument to Three Charters for National Reunification
 Pyongyang, June 12 (KCNA) -- Chief Jo Il Min and staff members of the Pyongyang Mission of the Anti-Imperialist National Democratic Front (AINDF) visited the Monument to the Three Charters for National Reunification on Wednesday on the occasion of the 13th anniversary of the historic June 15 joint declaration.
					 They went round the tower body, group sculptures of subsidiary theme, etc., being briefed on the fact that the monument was built in reflection of the desire and will of the fellow countrymen to convey down through generations the undying feats the peerlessly great persons performed for national reunification and reunify the country without fail.
					
					 At the end of the visit the chief said that the country can be reunified only when the June 15 joint declaration, the banner of independent reunification and landmark of national prosperity, is thoroughly implemented.
					
					 He stressed that the day of reunification would certainly come thanks to the dear respected Marshal Kim Jong Un, a peerlessly great man of Mt. Paektu.

articles.title: First Round of DPRK Premier Soccer League Ends
articles.content:
First Round of DPRK Premier Soccer League Ends
 Pyongyang, June 12 (KCNA) -- The first round of the premier soccer league came to an end on Tuesday after taking place at Kim Il Sung Stadium here as part of the Sports Contest for Pochonbo Torch Prize.
					 Hwaebul and Rimyongsu teams came first in the men's and women's events respectively in the first round. 
					
					 The second and third places in men's event were taken by the April 25 and Sobaeksu teams and those in women's event by Amnokgang and Wolmido.

articles.title: Information Workers Start Tour of Revolutionary Battle Sites
articles.content:
Information Workers Start Tour of Revolutionary Battle Sites
 Pyongyang, June 12 (KCNA) -- Information workers of primary organizations of trade unions started a study tour of revolutionary battle sites in the area of Mt. Paektu on the occasion of the 49th anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il's start of work at the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea.
					 A ceremony of kicking off the study tour took place before the Monument to the Victorious Battle of Pochonbo in Hyesan City, Ryanggang Province on Wednesday.
					
					 The participants laid a floral basket and bouquets before the statue of President Kim Il Sung on the monument and paid tribute to him.
					
					 At the ceremony the reporter and speakers underscored the need for the marchers to deeply grasp the revolutionary history and feats of the peerlessly great persons and firmly arm themselves with the revolutionary tradition of Juche.
					
					 At the end of the event the marchers went round the monument before visiting the Ryanggang Provincial Revolutionary Museum.

articles.title: Parquetry "World Map", Gift to Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Parquetry "World Map", Gift to Kim Jong Il
 Pyongyang, June 12 (KCNA) -- Among the exhibits at the International Friendship Exhibition House in the DPRK is a parquetry "World Map", a gift presented to leader Kim Jong Il by the center and group for the study of the Juche idea of Comrade Kim Il Sung in Guyana on October 10, Juche 69 (1980).
					 Out of profound reverence for Kim Jong Il, members of the center and the group made a decision to prepare a parquetry "World Map" as a gift to him on the occasion of the Sixth Congress of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK) and the 35th WPK anniversary.
					
					 The framed parquetry portrays the world map with the Korean Peninsula in its center and the Island of Guyana painted in dark brown color to be distinctive from other countries.
					
					 A flag with letters "Juche" is contained in the map.

articles.title: DPRK Girls Rise to Aces in Asian Acrobatic Gymnastics
articles.content:
DPRK Girls Rise to Aces in Asian Acrobatic Gymnastics
 Pyongyang, June 12 (KCNA) -- Jong Kum Hwa and Kim Hye Song of the Ministry of Commerce Sports Team in the DPRK won gold medals at two women etude in the 8th Asian Acrobatic Gymnastic Championship held in Kazakhstan some days ago.
					 The two women etude is divided into balancing speed and combination categories.
					
					 The two girls performed movements of highest technique in combination, thus overriding their rivals in total points of two categories. Their movements were what others dare not perform, as they are very difficult to do.
					
					 Experts said Jong Kum Hwa had strength enough to support her partner Kim Hye Song for more than 2 minutes and 30 seconds.
					
					 Supported by her, Kim could perform all high-level techniques, including the two rounds of somersault.
					
					 Their coach Kang Kum Hwa told KCNA:
					
					 "It was the first time for both Jong and Kim to take part in the international game.
					
					 Now they are working hard to take world's title."

articles.title: June 15 Declaration, Guidelines for Korea's Reunification
articles.content:
June 15 Declaration, Guidelines for Korea's Reunification
 Pyongyang, June 12 (KCNA) -- The historic June 15 Joint Declaration was adopted at the north-south summit held in Pyongyang in June Juche 89 (2000), the first of its kind in the history of Korea's division.
					 The keynote of the declaration is that the Korean nation is responsible for Korea's reunification and the issue of national reunification should be settled independently by the Korean nation itself.
					
					 The joint declaration had enjoyed full support at home and abroad soon after its publication.
					
					 With its publication, brisk dialogues and contacts began to resume between the north and the south of Korea and their relationship turned into that of reconciliation and cooperation from distrust and confrontation.
					
					 Roads and railways which had been severed between the north and the south for more than half a century were reconnected while air and sea routes opened to service. Meanwhile, a series of joint reunification-related events took place in the north and the south.
					
					 Afterwards, the October 4 Declaration was adopted as an action programme for implementing the June 15 Joint Declaration, giving greater hope and confidence in reaunification to the entire nation
					
					 But the Lee Myung Bak regime that emerged in south Korea later had totally negated those joint declarations, bringing the north-south relations to a rupture.
					
					 The facts go to clearly prove that implementation of the joint declarations is the only way for improving the north-south relations and ensuring peace of the Korean Peninsula and co-prosperity of the nation.
					
					 It is the cherished desire of all Koreans to achieve the country independently and peacefully by their concerted efforts while rejecting outsiders' intervention.
					
					 If the present south Korean authorities truly want detente and improved north-south relations, they should take practical steps to implement the June 15 Joint Declaration and the October 4 Declaration.
					
					 All Koreans will surely usher in a new era of independent reunification, united under the banner of "By our nation itself", the idea of the June 15 Joint Declatation.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Calls for Creating Atmosphere of Inter-Korean Dialogue
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Calls for Creating Atmosphere of Inter-Korean Dialogue
 Pyongyang, June 12 (KCNA) -- Creating an atmosphere of dialogue is an issue which should be solved before anything else for improving the inter-Korean ties, says Rodong Sinmun Wednesday  in a bylined article.
					 It goes on:
					
					 The issue of the inter-Korean relations cannot be resolved by the efforts of one party alone.
					
					 Only when both sides seek a settlement of all issues arising in the inter-Korean ties through dialogue at the negotiating table in a candid manner, can the north-south relations advance in the direction of reconciliation and unity.
					
					 The inter-Korean dialogue should be the one bringing hope and joy to all Koreans who ardently desire national reunification under any circumstances.
					
					 It is important to have a proper attitude towards dialogue in order to create such an atmosphere.
					
					 It is not a true attitude to antagonize or suspect a dialogue partner first.
					
					 If one pays lip-service to dialogue and pursues confrontation, speaking ill of its dialogue partner behind the scene, it will only stir up distrust and conflict among Koreans and adversely affect the dialogue itself.
					
					 The north-south dialogue is not a monopoly of someone and the national reunification movement is a nation-wide one involving all Koreans.
					
					 It is necessary to give momentum to the atmosphere of the north-south dialogue on the principle of subordinating everything to national interests and the cause of national reunification.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Slams Japan's Moves to Turn Japan into Military Giant
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Slams Japan's Moves to Turn Japan into Military Giant
 Pyongyang, June 12 (KCNA) -- Creating an atmosphere of dialogue is an issue which should be solved before anything else for improving the inter-Korean ties, says Rodong Sinmun Wednesday  in a bylined article.
					 It goes on:
					
					 The issue of the inter-Korean relations cannot be resolved by the efforts of one party alone.
					
					 Only when both sides seek a settlement of all issues arising in the inter-Korean ties through dialogue at the negotiating table in a candid manner, can the north-south relations advance in the direction of reconciliation and unity.

					 It is important to have a proper attitude towards dialogue in order to create such an atmosphere.
					
					 It is not a true attitude to antagonize or suspect a dialogue partner first.
					
					 If one pays lip-service to dialogue and pursues confrontation, speaking ill of its dialogue partner behind the scene, it will only stir up distrust and conflict among Koreans and adversely affect the dialogue itself.
					
					 The north-south dialogue is not a monopoly of someone and the national reunification movement is a nation-wide one involving all Koreans.
					
					 It is necessary to give momentum to the atmosphere of the north-south dialogue on the principle of subordinating everything to national interests and the cause of national reunification.

articles.title: Japanese Reactionaries Slammed for Moving to Grab Tok Islets
articles.content:
Japanese Reactionaries Slammed for Moving to Grab Tok Islets
 Pyongyang, June 12 (KCNA) -- The Japanese consulate in south Korea recently sent a warning document to a Japanese scholar who, after visiting the Tok Islets, asserted they belonged to Korea from long ago.
					 Minju Joson Wednesday observes in a bylined commentary in this regard:
					
					 This is a base act not suited to the highly-civilized era in the 21st century.
					
					 Tok Islets have been part of the inviolable territory of Korea from the olden times and have never been part of the Japanese territory.
					
					 This has been proved by many historic data and the Japanese reactionaries all know this.
					
					 But they, regarding it as important for realizing their ambition for overseas aggression to grab the islets, have worked hard to do so at any cost.
					
					 As disclosed, after the Japanese scholar and his party entered south Korea, the Japanese consulate called them several times and threatened them not to go to the islets, inquiring about every detail of their itinerary.
					
					 It is a base and poor mode of thinking that they think they can mislead history by gagging a few people and realize their shameless ambition for grabbing the islets.
					
					 Tok Islets were, are and will be part of the inviolable territory of Korea no matter how hard Japan may try to distort the truth of history and bury it into oblivion.
					
					 The Korean nation will never allow anyone to encroach upon even a blade of grass on the islets.
					
					 The Japanese reactionaries should frankly accept the truth of history, though belatedly.

articles.title: Capitalism Has No Future: Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
Capitalism Has No Future: Rodong Sinmun
 Pyongyang, June 12 (KCNA) -- The ruling quarters in capitalist countries and their advocates claim that capitalist society is "humanitarian society where humanity is fully guaranteed." This is sheer sophism to cover up the nature of capitalism nearing its end and beautify the reactionary nature of society.
					 A bylined article of Rodong Sinmun says this Wednesday.
					
					 Saying that humanity is disappearing in modern capitalist society, the article goes on:
					
					 In capitalist society money is like a cure-all that makes people or breaks people. 
					
					 Capitalists intentionally create inhuman demands, rendering the people's material living deformed.
					
					 They also have become mad in spreading reactionary and unpopular ideology and culture and corrupt bourgeois lifestyle to benumb the people's independent ideological awareness and make them obey to capitalists' exploitation.
					
					 This is making the people's mental and cultural life all the more poor in capitalist society.
					
					 The living ethic and mode of existence based on the jungle law have become major factors that undermine humanity in capitalist society.
					
					 Amusement-oriented and perverted lifestyle is guaranteed by politics and law under capitalism.
					
					 Capitalism has no future and is bound to meet destruction as it undermines humanity, concludes the article.

articles.title: Collection of Properties of Chun Doo Hwan Demanded in S. Korea
articles.content:
Collection of Properties of Chun Doo Hwan Demanded in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, June 12 (KCNA) -- Civic and public organizations in Kwangju, south Korea held a press conference in Seoul on Monday demanding the collection of all properties of traitor Chun Doo Hwan, a military dictator and murderer, according to south Korean KBS.
					 At the conference the organizations accused Chun of enjoying a luxury life with assets he amassed through irregularities and corruption during his office. Nevertheless, he insisted that he did not have big properties, the organizations noted, adding it is necessary for the prosecution to make a thoroughgoing investigation into his concealed properties.
					
					 They demanded the "National Assembly" immediately adopt a bill on forcibly collecting his properties.

articles.title: S. Korean Authorities' Suppression of Sit-in Strike Protested
articles.content:
S. Korean Authorities' Suppression of Sit-in Strike Protested
 Pyongyang, June 12 (KCNA) -- The south Korean Confederation of Trade Unions released a statement on Monday denouncing the puppet authorities for forcibly evacuating sit-in strike sites of workers in their action for vital rights, according to south Korean KBS.
					 The statement expressed resentment at the Central District Office and the Socho District Office in Seoul that hurled on the same day security forces into forcibly evacuating a sit-in strike site for settling the case of Ssangyong Motors and a sit-in strike site of part-time workers of Hyundai Motors.
					
					 Such tyrannical action taken on the anniversary of the June 10 resistance is a mockery of the spirit of democratization, it charged.
					
					 It accused the authorities of persistently lending no ear to the voices of workers.

articles.title: Move for Transfer of Right to Command Control Wartime Operations under Fire
articles.content:
Move for Transfer of Right to Command Control Wartime Operations under Fire
 Pyongyang, June 12 (KCNA) -- The People for Achieving Peace and Reunification of south Korea held a press conference outside the building of the puppet Defense Ministry on June 3 condemning the deceptive move for transferring the right to command wartime operations. 
					 Speakers there accused the military authorities of south Korea and the U.S. of mulling setting up a new command to replace the "Combined Forces Command" under the pretext of transferring the right to command wartime operations.
					
					 It is natural to dissolve the "Combined Forces Command", they said, asserting that to establish a new command under this pretext is nothing but a cynical ploy to nullify the transfer of the right to command wartime operations and deceive the people.
					
					 The authorities claim that the issue can be settled if the title is changed and the post of the commander is taken by a south Korean general but this is a sheer farce because the right to command information, operation and logistics and the system for tactical command and automation, the core elements for carrying out a war, are still in hands of the U.S. forces, it held.
					
					 It was agreed, in particular, that the U.S. forces would not transfer the right to command the operations of the air force but still command tactical echelon drills of army corps- and division-level, large-scale assault landing operations, etc., a clear indication that the right to command wartime operations cannot be properly transferred, they noted.
					
					 The military authorities try to keep the mechanism of the "Combined Forces Command" as it is but the people will not be fooled any longer, they warned.

articles.title: Koreans in China Call for National Reconciliation
articles.content:
Koreans in China Call for National Reconciliation 
 Pyongyang, June 12 (KCNA) -- The General Association of Koreans in China issued a statement on June 7 in support of the special statement released by a spokesman for the Committee for the Peaceful Reunification of Korea.
					 The special statement called for holding talks between the authorities of the north and the south to normalize the operation in the Kaesong Industrial Zone and resume the tours to Mt. Kumgang resort on the occasion of the anniversary of the June 15 joint declaration, giving hope for the improvement of the stalled inter-Korean relations and national reconciliation and unity, the statement said.
					
					 The General Association of Koreans in China warmly hails and positively supports the special statement as a patriotic, bold resolution to achieve national reunification, peace and prosperity, the cherished desire of the nation, at any cost, it noted, adding:
					
					 It is very regrettable that the Korean nation is spending days and months in acute contradiction and confrontation.
					
					 Defying the vicious moves of the separatists in the past, the Koreans have ushered in a new heyday for national reconciliation, unity, peace and prosperity including the publication of the June 15 joint declaration and the July 4 joint statement by turning adversity into a favorable condition.
					
					 We should remove misunderstanding and mistrust and open a new phase of reconciliation and unity through dialogues such as north-south joint celebrations of the anniversaries of the June 15 joint declaration and the July 4 joint statement shining with gold letters in the history of the sacred struggle for national reunification.
					
					 As the saying goes that a journey of a thousand miles begins with one step, the north and the south should build confidence, discussing the pending issues such as the issue of normalizing the operation in the Kaesong Industrial Zone, the issue of resuming the tours to Mt. Kumgang resort and the issue of reunion of the separated families and their relatives.
					
					 The south Korean authorities should have the sincere stand and attitude toward the improvement of the inter-Korean relations as unanimously demanded by all the fellow countrymen.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un's Work Posted on Peruvian Website
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un's Work Posted on Peruvian Website
 Pyongyang, June 12 (KCNA) -- The Peruvian-Korean Institute of Culture and Friendship posted the dear respected Kim Jong Un's work "Let Us Brilliantly Accomplish the Revolutionary Cause of Juche, Holding Kim Jong Il in High Esteem as the Eternal General Secretary of Our Party" on its website on June 6.
					 The work, published on April 6, Juche 101 (2012), clarifies that it is a principled requirement for victoriously advancing the cause of the Korean revolution to hold leader Kim Jong Il in high esteem as  eternal general secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK).
					
					 It sets forth the tasks to be fulfilled to steadily develop the WPK as a glorious party of President Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il.
					
					 A portrait of Kim Jong Il was posted on the website.

articles.title: Anniversary of Start of Work at WPK Central Committee Observed Abroad
articles.content:
Anniversary of Start of Work at WPK Central Committee Observed Abroad
 Pyongyang, June 12 (KCNA) -- Events took place in different countries to mark the 49th anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il's start of work at the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK).
					 A meeting was held in Tajikistan, a lecture in Kyrgyzstan and a seminar, photo exhibition and film show in Bangladesh on June 4.
					
					 Displayed in the venue of the photo exhibition were photos on the immortal exploits performed by President Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il in party building and their Songun revolutionary feats.
					
					 Participants in the film show watched Korean film "Pyongyang at Night."
					
					 Kurbonzyon Mirzoyeva, member of the Presidium of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of Tajikistan, said Kim Jong Il consolidated in every way the cohesion and unity of the whole party in thought and purpose centering around Kim Il Sung and built the WPK into an invincible party. 
					
					 The U.S. imperialists dared not provoke a war against the DPRK while persisting in their moves to stifle it, because it has powerful military capability built up by Kim Jong Il, the member noted.
					
					 A. Usupbayev, chairman of the Central Council of the People Unity-"Kyrgyz El" Republican Political Party who is chief of the Group for the Study of the Juche Idea, said that the WPK turned into a party in which the leader and masses formed a harmonious whole and an invincible party unperturbed in any storm and stress under the wise leadership of Kim Jong Il.
					
					 M. Jahangir Khan, chairman of the Bangladesh Group for the Study of the Songun Policy, said that the Juche idea, Songun idea enunciated by Kim Jong Il as a guiding idea of the cause of independence is commanding full support and sympathy among world people.

articles.title: Peruvian Organizations Support Inter-Korean Declaration
articles.content:
Peruvian Organizations Support Inter-Korean Declaration
 Pyongyang, June 12 (KCNA) -- Peruvian organizations made public statements on June 4 and 6 to mark the 13th anniversary of the June 15 North-South Joint Declaration.
					 The Peruvian Group of the Study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism in its statement said that the adoption of the June 15 joint declaration was an eye-opening event, indeed, adding:
					
					 The declaration is a historic one which reaffirmed the fact that the Koreans are the same nation that can never live separated and the issue of the country's reunification should be settled by the Koreans themselves in an independent and peaceful way. 
					
					 Thanks to its adoption dialogue and exchange were brisk in different fields between the north and south of Korea and the June 15 era of reunification was ushered in the Korean Peninsula.
					
					 What the Korean nation desires is peace and reunification, not war and division.
					
					 The U.S. should no longer impose pain of division upon the Korean nation but get out of south Korea.
					
					 We invariably support the June 15 joint declaration.
					
					 The Peruvian Committee for Supporting the Independent and Peaceful Reunification of Korea in its statement noted that undying are the feats Kim Jong Il performed by ushering in the new era of independent reunification, the June 15 era of reunification through the dedication of his whole life to the accomplishment of the cause of national reunification.
					
					 The statement went on:
					
					 We, on behalf of progressive political parties and organizations in Peru, express invariable support to the June 15 joint declaration.
					
					 They are convinced that the Korean people would surely achieve the independent and peaceful reunification of the country under the Songun leadership of the dear respected Marshal Kim Jong Un, true to the last instructions of the great Generalissimos Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il for national reunification.

articles.title: Romanian Party Leader Wishes Korean People Victory in Stand-off with US
articles.content:
Romanian Party Leader Wishes Korean People Victory in Stand-off with US
 Pyongyang, June 12 (KCNA) -- The Korean people will always emerge victorious in the stand-off with the U.S. in the future, too, as they are led by Supreme Commander Kim Jong Un who has successfully carried forward the revolutionary exploits of the preceding leaders.
					 Vasile Orleanu, chairman of the Supreme Council of the Socialist Party of Romania, said this when addressing the inaugural meeting of the Romanian national preparatory committee for celebrating the 60th anniversary of the Korean people's victory in the Korean War.
					
					 July 27 is a historic day when the Korean people defeated the U.S. imperialists, the formidable enemy, and a shameful day which marked the beginning of the downhill turn for the U.S. which boasted of "invincibility," he noted.
					
					 The U.S. has always made every desperate effort to stifle the DPRK but the former can not escape its setback. This is proved by history.

articles.title: Anniversary of Korean People's Victory in War to Be Celebrated in Romania
articles.content:
Anniversary of Korean People's Victory in War to Be Celebrated in Romania
Pyongyang, June 12 (KCNA) -- A Romanian national preparatory committee was inaugurated with due ceremony at the building of the Socialist Party of Romania on June 5 to celebrate the 60th anniversary of the Korean people's victory in the Fatherland Liberation War.
					 Vasile Orleanu, chairman of the Supreme Council of the Party, was elected chairman of the preparatory committee at the inaugural ceremony.
					
					 The committee set the days from June 25 to July 27 as a celebration period and decided to organize diverse political and cultural events in the period.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un felicita a presidente y pueblo de Rusia
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un felicita a presidente y pueblo de Rusia
Pyongyang, 12 de junio (ACNC) -- El Primer Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Kim Jong Un, envio hoy un mensaje de felicitacion al Presidente de la Federacion Rusa, Vladimir Vladimirovich Putin, con motivo del Dia Nacional de ese pais.
					La misiva sigue:
					
					Extiendo mis felicitaciones a Vd. y a su pueblo con motivo del Dia Nacional de la Federacion Rusa.
					
					Bajo su direccion, el pueblo ruso logra muchos exitos en los proyectos para modernizar la economia, fortalecer el poderio de defensa nacional y lograr la estabilidad social.
					
					Estamos complacidos por el respecto y deseamos que den frutos magnificos los esfuerzos de Vd. y su pueblo por defender la paz y la seguridad del mundo y construir una Rusia poderosa.
					
					Aprovechando esta oportunidad, manifiesto la conviccion de que las tradicionales relaciones de amistad Corea-Rusia seguiran ampliandose y desarrollandose de acuerdo con el espiritu de los documentos conjuntos acordados entre ambas partes.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam felicita al presidente de Filipinas
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam felicita al presidente de Filipinas
Pyongyang, 12 de junio (ACNC) -- El presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Kim Yong Nam, envio este miercoles un mensaje de felicitacion al presidente de la Republica de Filipinas, Benigno Simeon Cojuangco Aquino, con motivo del 115o aniversario de la independencia de ese pais. 
					Convencido de que las relaciones entre Corea y Filipinas se desarrollaran de acuerdo con los intereses y la aspiracion comunes de ambos pueblos, el remitente desea al mandatario exitos en su trabajo para el progreso y prosperidad del pais.

articles.title: Enviadas ofrendas florales a embajada de Indonesia en RPDC
articles.content:
Enviadas ofrendas florales a embajada de Indonesia en RPDC
Pyongyang, 12 de junio (ACNC) -- Los organismos de las fuerzas armadas y el poder, ministerios y organos centrales enviaron los dias 11 y 12 las ofrendas florales a la Embajada de la Republica de Indonesia en Corea para expresar condolecidas por el deceso de Taufiq Kiemas, presidente de la Asamblea Consultiva del Pueblo de Indonesia. 
					Fueron colocadas al pie de la foto del difunto las ofrendas florales enviadas por el Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, el Ministerio de las Fuerzas Armadas Populares, el Ministerio de Relaciones Exteriores, el Comite Coreano de Relaciones Culturales con el Extranjero, la Asociacion de Amistad Corea-Indonesia y la Direccion General de Trabajo con el Cuerpo Diplomatico. 
					
					 En la ceremonia de condolencias estuvieron presentes el vicepresidente de la APS, Kim Wan Su, el vicecanciller Pak Kil Yon, el presidente de la Asociacion de Amistad Corea-Indonesia y vicepresidente del Comite Coreano de Relaciones Culturales con el Extranjero, Kim Jin Bom, el subdirector general de Trabajo con el Cuerpo Diplomatico, Mun Jae Chol, y otros funcionarios. 
					
					 Los participantes guardaron un momento de silencio en memoria del difunto y firmaron el libro de condolencias.

articles.title: Minju Joson denuncia ambicion de reaccionarios japoneses sobre islote Tok
articles.content:
Minju Joson denuncia ambicion de reaccionarios japoneses sobre islote Tok
Pyongyang, 12 de junio (ACNC) -- Hace poco, el consulado de Japon en Sur de Corea envio una llamada nota de advertencia a un historiador japones quien visito el islote Tok y confirmo que historicamente este forma parte del territorio coreano.
					El periodico Minju Joson, en un comentario individual difundido este miercoles, senala que eso es conducta grosera e inadecuada a la epoca civilizada del siglo 21, y continua:
					
					El islote Tok, territorio propio de Corea desde la antiguedad, no ha sido nunca tierra japonesa.
					
					Los reaccionarios japoneses saben que existen muchos datos historicos que comprueban ese hecho.
					
					Pero, ellos consideran que la usurpacion del islote Tok es etapa importante para realizar su ambicion de agredir a ultramar.
					
					Segun los hechos conocidos, desde que llego al suelo surcoreano la comitiva del historiador japones, el consulado de Japon en el Sur de Corea le telefoneo varias veces obligando a no visitar el islote Tok.
					
					Japon considera que puede distorsionar la historia y realizar su descarada ambicion de usurpar el territorio ajeno amordazando a algunos.
					
					Aunque Japon intente mucho tergiversar y ocultar la verdad de historia, el islote Tok fue, es y sera siempre sagrada tierra coreana.
					
					La nacion coreana no perdonara jamas que alguien trate de ultrajar algo del islote Tok.
					
					Los reaccionarios japoneses deben reconocer sinceramente los hechos de historia.
